sub_title: EU Project Manager at University of Groningen
summary:
Project Manager with a history of working in the higher education industry where I manage the convenient interaction between private and public institutions and stakeholders to achieve the goals.
My legal background together with the experience and aptitudes developed along the different appointments, provide the right mix that will ensure that we reach together the objectives set. Finally, I am able not only to maintain the optimal level of self-motivation until the targets are reached but also to encourage and motivate other actors involved, being team colleagues, management or stakeholders. Currently developing knowledge in legal questions related to electronic transactions and especially autonomous driving, vehicles and transport such as AI, privacy, infrastructure.

profile_positions.description:
ENLIGHT stands for European university Network to promote equitable quality of Life, sustainability and Global engagement through Higher education Transformation
ENLIGHT brings together nine comprehensive, research-intensive universities from nine European countries (Belgium, Estonia, France, Germany, Ireland, Netherlands, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden), training over 300,000 learners per year and sharing a deep commitment to their social responsibility.

OUR MISSION is to contribute to the fundamental transformation of European Higher Education that empowers learners as globally engaged citizens with state-of-the-art knowledge, skills, and innovation potential to tackle major societal transitions and to promote equitable quality of life and sustainability. To this end, ENLIGHT will establish the foundations of an integrated European University System with free movement of students and staff and sharing of resources that gradually links the structures of quality assurance, international outreach and global engagement, talent recruitment and investment in large research infrastructure.
profile_positions.title: EU Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
The Teaching Academy Groningen (TAG) is a platform to share good practices and develop knowledge in order to enhance innovative education at the University of Groningen. With the expertise of our current TAG members and other stakeholders, we form a dynamic community of practice since 2017, providing a platform for interdisciplinary and innovative teaching powered by research and practice.
Since the beginning of 2021 the Teaching Academy Team is formed by dedicated leadership (an Academic Leader and Leaders of thematic Communities of Expertise, as well as a Support team. Research positions will also be available soon.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Best Practice 2020 is the programme set up to improve business operations within the UG. It is about modernizing the business operations systems and the processes they involve for HR (including salary administration), Finance and University Services. Best Practice - The Simple Standard stands for a system witk work processes that have already proven themselves elsewhere and work well, efficiently and in a user-friendly manner.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
EQUiiP Educational Quality at Universities for inclusive international Programmes
EQUiiP provides educational developers and teacher trainers with an integrated programme of Continuing Professional Development modules for use during the internationalisation of higher education, as well as an International Competence Profile for Educational Developers and a set of EQUiiP Recommendations.
https://equiip.eu

company.name: University of Groningen, Faculty of Law

profile_positions.company: University of Groningen, Faculty of Law
profile_positions.description:
EU Project Manager within the STeP Research Group (Security, Technology & e-Privacy Research Group) at the Faculty of Law of the University of Groningen.

Main responsibilities:
- management of the quantitative and qualitative research processes to be conducted in various countries across different projects
- management and coordination of all the procedures (legal, financial, scientific and administrative procedures) of two European projects (Horizon 2020) in close collaboration with the project coordinator and project coordination team.
- management and coordination of the activities of the project’s coordination team and the research partners to ensure timely and effective delivery of the project objectives, deliverables and milestones, including the preparation of financial and other reports for the projects 
- management of communication with various parties, among which the European Commission, the project consortium and various stakeholder groups 
- organisation of project conferences and meetings in and mostly outside of The Netherlands on a regular basis 
- identification, preparation and implementation of improvement measures of related processes
profile_positions.title: EU Projects Manager

Service Optimization
Process& Projects - Service & Performance Management team
- Responsible for Customer Relationship Management of the SSC (Global Communication; Global process definition)
- Communication, contribution to development and analysis of reports related to performance – (Service Reporting: KPIs; Quality management) 
- Registration and follow-up on “Escalations” and improvement ideas until a solution or accomplishment (Conflict management). 
- Organization of workshops with partners aimed at process standardization and improvement, involving process partners and process experts (Continuous improvement)
